org.springframework.http.codec

Class ResourceHttpMessageWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.http.codec.AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter<Resource>
      • org.springframework.http.codec.ResourceHttpMessageWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpMessageWriter<Resource>, ServerHttpMessageWriter<Resource>

    public class ResourceHttpMessageWriter
extends AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter<Resource>
    Implementation of HttpMessageWriter that can write Resources.

    For a Resource reader simply use ResourceDecoder wrapped with DecoderHttpMessageReader.

    Since:
    5.0
    Author:
    Arjen Poutsma, Brian Clozel

      Invoked before writing the response to resolve hints by AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter.write(Publisher, ResolvableType, ResolvableType, MediaType, ServerHttpRequest, ServerHttpResponse, Map).

      Write an given object to the given output message.

      Write a given object to the given output message with additional server related parameters which could be used to create some hints or set the response status for example.

      • resolveWriteHints

        protected Map<String,Object> resolveWriteHints(ResolvableType streamType,
                                               ResolvableType elementType,
                                               MediaType mediaType,
                                               ServerHttpRequest request)
        Description copied from class: AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter
        Invoked before writing the response to resolve hints by AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter.write(Publisher, ResolvableType, ResolvableType, MediaType, ServerHttpRequest, ServerHttpResponse, Map).
        Specified by:
        resolveWriteHints in class AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter<Resource>
        Parameters:
        streamType - the original type used for the method return value. For annotation based controllers, the MethodParameter is available via ResolvableType.getSource().
        elementType - the stream element type to process
        mediaType - the content type to use when writing. May be null to indicate that the default content type of the converter must be used.
        request - the current HTTP request
        Returns:
        additional information about how to write the body

      • write

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Void> write(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<? extends Resource> inputStream,
                                               ResolvableType elementType,
                                               MediaType mediaType,
                                               ReactiveHttpOutputMessage outputMessage,
                                               Map<String,Object> hints)
        Description copied from interface: HttpMessageWriter
        Write an given object to the given output message.
        Specified by:
        write in interface HttpMessageWriter<Resource>
        Overrides:
        write in class AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter<Resource>
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the input stream to write
        elementType - the stream element type to process. This type must have previously been passed to the HttpMessageWriter.canWrite(org.springframework.core.ResolvableType, org.springframework.http.MediaType) canWrite} method of this interface, which must have returned true.
        mediaType - the content type to use when writing, typically the value of an Accept header. May be null to indicate that the default content type of the converter must be used.
        outputMessage - the message to write to
        hints - additional information about how to write
        Returns:
        a Mono that indicates completion or error

      • write

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Void> write(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<? extends Resource> inputStream,
                                               ResolvableType streamType,

                                               MediaType mediaType,

        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpMessageWriter
        Write a given object to the given output message with additional server related parameters which could be used to create some hints or set the response status for example.
        Specified by:
        write in interface ServerHttpMessageWriter<Resource>
        Overrides:
        write in class AbstractServerHttpMessageWriter<Resource>
        streamType - the original type used for the method return value. For annotation based controllers, the MethodParameter is available via ResolvableType.getSource(). Can be null.
        elementType - the stream element type to process
        mediaType - the content type to use when writing. May be null to indicate that the default content type of the converter must be used.
        request - the current HTTP request
        response - the current HTTP response
        Returns:
        a Mono that indicates completion or error
